page.title: 01NEWTON ST.CYRES AND HOOKWAY
page.content: The block is bordered in the north by the{Rivers YEO and CREEDY}and the {BARNSTAPLE/EXETER railway.}It contains part of NEWTON PARISH,the hamlet of HOOKWAY and a tiny part of WHITESTONE The land (mainly hilly) is used for grazing, crops and conifer woodlands. Amenities are a church, bus route, pottery, two farm produce shops, golf course and a parish hall. (See NEWTON ST,CYRES & UPTON PYNE).{QUICKE'S {CHEESE/FARM employs 43 people mostly {from the village.}Newton House is now divided into flats and Sherwood House is perhaps the largest house in the area.Most of the people live in WOODLANDS (houses built in 1966) or cob/stone dwellings in{WEST TOWN and {HOOKWAY} and scattered farms or cottages.{Heavy traffic on the A377 {road and sewage problems are the main {issues.
